events.name: Product Data Management (Siemens PLM) - Workshop (07th Sep)
events.description:
Together with Siemens principle, will show case your benefits in secure your design CAD data, reduce corrective actions, and spend your resources on productive improvements by NX/UG integrated PDM. NX Manager does not have hassles in Hardware Infrastructure,  Database Servers, no additional IT resources, no up front License costs.
* Part Numbering Enforcement
* File name changes and Revision controls, prohibiting broken links in assembly data

events.name: Fireside Chat with Co-Founder & CTO of TradeGecko
events.description:
Tech Talk is a series of fireside chats hosted by General Assembly featuring technical leads of startups and corporates.

This session, we're hosting a fireside chat with Bradley Priest, Co-Founder and CTO of TradeGecko.

About Bradley Priest

Bradley is the CTO and Co-Founder of TradeGecko. When he's not writing immense walls of code he's writing immense walls of code.

Bradley was the kid that was always pulling things apart and (sometimes) putting them back together again. After studying psychology and medicine, and realising neither floated his boat, Bradley found his calling in the world of technology.

Quite obviously a natural, starting TradeGecko was his chance to utilize all of his technical and creative skills, building market-leading software from the ground up. He now leads an ever growing team of talented developers and designers helping drive the shared mission of creating the effortless inventory and order management platform that the world transacts upon.

About TradeGecko

TradeGecko was founded in February 2012, by three entrepreneurs from New Zealand – brothers Cameron and Bradley Priest along with Carl Thompson. The founders saw an opportunity in Southeast Asia and moved to Singapore to be incubated by technology accelerator, JFDI. Previously running businesses ranging from retail apparel to web design, TradeGecko was born out of a frustration to efficiently manage and track retail inventory and warehouse administration. After quick market uptake of the initial TradeGecko solution and after securing significant early-stage funding, TradeGecko’s adoption grew rapidly amongst online retailers and wholesalers. TradeGecko is now the most intuitive, technology-driven cloud solution serving a global customer base in over 100 countries and making wholesale transactions as easy as shopping on Amazon.

TradeGecko have raised over USD 12M from world-class investors, including; The National Research Foundation of Singapore, Golden Gate Ventures, Wave Maker Labs, Jungle Ventures, 500 Startups and NSI Ventures.
events.location: General Assembly, Level 3, 8 Claymore Hill, Space Mob, Singapore 229572

events.name: WordPress Meetup (September 2017)
events.description: Lightning Talk: Amazon Lightsail Hosting for WordPressSpeaker: Lillian So, AWS Talk 1: How we built walkabout.sg with WordPress (from a non-technical perspective)  Speaker: Kristine Lauria, Walkabout.sg  Talk 2: How to Outsource like a Boss Speaker: Paul Luxford, WPGeni.com And if we get more time -  Open Q&A: Please comment (below) on topics you would like to discuss, experts & enthusiasts present will answer questions. This will be casual. Possible topics could be - • What makes a good theme??  • My site loads slow, how do I make it faster?  • And more (just comment)  Are you interested in sharing something about WordPress as well? Let us know!  Do join us from 7pm for a 7:30pm start. We're always looking for speakers and volunteers to help with our meetups! Please contact us if you're interested in helping out.  Please call Jon at[masked] if you have an issue getting to the meetup. Do not abuse the number please :)
events.location: Amazon Web Services Office, Level 10 Capital Square, 23 Church Street, Singapore 049481

events.name: Machine Learning for Beginners - A Guide for Newbies
events.description: We will be conducting a free meetup to teach machine learning to new programmers. Find out why machine learning is the next big thing of the future. This is a very basic course, we highly recommend it to anyone who's interested to learn more about machine learning even if you have no prior background at all. The teacher is Mr Setu. With more than 11 years of experience in IT, he leads the machine learning team in Nielsen Singapore. This course will be taught in Python. There are no prerequisites for this lesson! All you need is a never say die attitude and a insatiable appetitie to learn! Spaces are limited for only 45 students.
events.location: Tri5 Ventures, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #03-26, S139951, Singapore
